conclusion: Number of turns of the coil N = 200, Area of the coil S = 1 m^2, Resistance of the coil r = 10 Ω, External resistor resistance R = 50 Ω, Magnetic field change with time as shown in Figure B.
The change in magnetic flux ΔΦ through the coil is given by ΔΦ = N ⋅ S ⋅ ΔB.
From the graph, the rate of change of magnetic field ΔB/Δt = (0.4 - 0.2)/(4 - 0) = 0.05 T/s.
The induced EMF, ε = N ⋅ S ⋅ ΔB/Δt.
The total resistance in the circuit is R + r = 50 + 10 = 60 Ω.
Using Ohm's Law, I = ε/(R + r) = 10/60 = 1/6 A.
Power P consumed by resistor R is given by P = I^2 ⋅ R.
The maximum power consumed by R is 25/18 W.
